article.headline: Montana 76, Sacramento St. 69
article.story: SACRAMENTO (AP) -- Jordan Hasquet's 19 points, 11 rebounds and two assists led Montana to a 76-69 victory over Sacramento State on Saturday night. Andrew Strait added 13 points and 12 rebounds, and Matt Martin had 10 points, six assists and two steals for Montana (7-9, 1-2 Big Sky). Loren Leath had 19 points and Justin Williams added 16 points for the Hornets (3-12, 1-4). Trailing 45-34 early in the second half, the Hornets charged back to cut the Grizzlies' lead 52-49 on a basket by Williams with 8:36 left. Montana picked up their defense, then went up by 11 points on a basket and two free throws by Hasquet with 5:33 left. The Hornets never got closer than six points the rest of the way. Kyle Sharp scored three straight baskets and Martin added a trifecta to give the Grizzlies a 23-14 margin in the first half. Sac State came back to tie the game 32-32 with a free throw by Justin Eller, but Hasquet's two free throws with 1.7 seconds left gave Montana a 34-32 halftime lead.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
